headline: CDC extends ban on cruising through October after White House reportedly overrules longer extension
summary: Executives of the cruise companies and the industry trade group are planning a meeting at the White House on Friday, CNBC's Seema Mody reported.

summary: Facebook on Wednesday announced that it will now ban any ads in support of the far-right group Qanon and any militarized social movements.

summary: American AirlinesÂ will move ahead with plans to furlough 19,000 workers on Thursday after talks for a national coronavirus aid package failed in Washington, but the airline is prepared to reverse course if a deal is reached, its CEO said.

summary: "Asana's definitely worth something ... [but] it's too high now," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

headline: Facebook will ban ads that seek to delegitimize US election
summary: Facebook on Wednesday announced that it will not allow any ads on its service that seek to delegitimize the outcome of an election, including the upcoming U.S. election on Nov. 3.

headline: The Trump-Biden debate helped the stock market go higher, Jim Cramer says
summary: "Wall Street was worried about a lot of things going into last night's debate and almost none of them came true," the "Mad Money" host said.

headline: Stock futures flat as investors brace for final quarter of 2020
summary: The first trading day of the fourth and final quarter of 2020 occurs on Thursday.

headline: Hard seltzer market is big enough for multiple brands, says Molson Coors CEO
summary: "The key with our portfolio of brands is they're going to be very differentiated," Molson Coors CEO Gavin Hattersley said on CNBC.

Coinbase CEO discourages politics at work, offers generous severance to employees who want to quit
summary: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong told staff in an email that the company would offer four-to-six-month severance packages for anyone "who doesn't feel comfortable with this new direction."

headline: Fed's Daly calls for more fiscal help to get the economy out of a 'big ditch'
summary: Daly likened the rescue funding so far to a bridge that has helped growth recover somewhat but still needs to be extended.

summary: Apollo's Joshua Harris discussed the SPAC boom at the Delivering Alpha conference presented by CNBC and Institutional Investor.

headline: Palihapitiya says election won't matter, stocks going higher next 4 years: 'You need to be long'
summary: Social Capital Founder and Chief Executive Officer Chamath Palihapitiya said the stock market will continue to move higher regardless of a Trump or Biden presidency.

headline: Near-zero interest rates may be needed for up to 3 years, says Dallas Fed's Robert Kaplan
summary: "Obviously, we're doing extraordinary actions, not just the Fed funds rate ... but we need to because it's a crisis," Dallas Fed President Robert Kaplan told CNBC.
